title: How Eddie Jones' England team to take on Australia echoes superb Six Nations win over Ireland
text:
Coaches are human. They undoubtedly have favourite players – individuals on whom they stake their reputations and rely on in big matches.

It would make sense that they have favourite team performances as well. Some games must stick in the memory as possible templates for future success.

England’s 32-20 win over Ireland in Dublin that began this year’s Six Nations has been arguably the most authoritative display of Eddie Jones’ tenure as head coach.

So, understandably, there seem to be similarities in how the Australian is approaching Saturday’s Rugby World Cup quarter-final against his compatriots in Oita. Jones is even sprinkling the same word – “brutal” – as liberally across his pre-match media...
